sentence.text: This phenotypic variability should be taken into account when treating patients with positive regulation of protein phosphorylation-associated neurodegenerative disease.

Recessive mutations in positive regulation of protein phosphorylation cause lethal neonatal rigidity and multifocal seizure syndrome, a phenotype characterized by neonatal microcephaly, hypertonia, and refractory epilepsy with premature death by age 2 years.

Here, we report two affected siblings with compound heterozygous truncating mutations in positive regulation of protein phosphorylation and intra-familial phenotypic heterogeneity, with a less severe disease course in the female sibling.
